text:
Hello Digital Asset/Canton Utility Team,
I am deploying the Canton Utility UI in an environment where the validator and participant (Daml Ledger API) are running as separate APIs, each with its own Audience (Identifier) in Auth0:
 Daml Ledger API Audience: <https://ledger_api.hashkeycloudcanton.com>
 Validator App API Audience: <https://validator.hashkeycloudcanton.com/api>
According to the official documentation, it is recommended that both the participant and validator APIs use the same audience value. However, Auth0 does not allow two APIs to have the same Identifier/Audiencethis results in a configuration error on the Auth0 side.
As a result, the Utility UI frontend can only be configured with a single AUTH_AUDIENCE value. This means that the access token it obtains is only valid for one of the APIs (either the participant or the validator), and any requests to the other API result in a 401 Unauthorized error due to audience mismatch.
Summary of the issue:
 Auth0 enforces unique Identifiers (Audiences) for each API, so it is impossible to set the same audience for both APIs.
 The Utility UI frontend only supports a single AUTH_AUDIENCE environment variable, so it cannot obtain tokens for both APIs at the same time.
 This results in 401 errors when the frontend tries to access the API whose audience does not match the token.
Questions:
1. Is there an official solution or recommended workaround for supporting multiple API audiences in the Utility UI when using Auth0?
2. Are there plans to support multiple audiences/tokens in the Utility UI frontend, so that it can dynamically obtain and use the correct token for each API?
3. Is there any guidance for integrating with Auth0 (or other OIDC providers) in environments where audience unification is not possible?
This is a critical blocker for us, as we have other services relying on the separation of API audiences for security reasons, and cannot merge them into a single audience.
Thank you for your help!
Best regards,

elements.text:
Hello Digital Asset/Canton Utility Team,
I am deploying the Canton Utility UI in an environment where the validator and participant (Daml Ledger API) are running as separate APIs, each with its own Audience (Identifier) in Auth0:
Daml Ledger API Audience:
Validator App API Audience:

According to the official documentation, it is recommended that both the participant and validator APIs use the same audience value. However, Auth0 does not allow two APIs to have the same Identifier/Audiencethis results in a configuration error on the Auth0 side.
As a result, the Utility UI frontend can only be configured with a single AUTH_AUDIENCE value. This means that the access token it obtains is only valid for one of the APIs (either the participant or the validator), and any requests to the other API result in a 401 Unauthorized error due to audience mismatch.
Summary of the issue:
Auth0 enforces unique Identifiers (Audiences) for each API, so it is impossible to set the same audience for both APIs.
The Utility UI frontend only supports a single AUTH_AUDIENCE environment variable, so it cannot obtain tokens for both APIs at the same time.
This results in 401 errors when the frontend tries to access the API whose audience does not match the token.
Questions:
Is there an official solution or recommended workaround for supporting multiple API audiences in the Utility UI when using Auth0?
Are there plans to support multiple audiences/tokens in the Utility UI frontend, so that it can dynamically obtain and use the correct token for each API?
Is there any guidance for integrating with Auth0 (or other OIDC providers) in environments where audience unification is not possible?

This is a critical blocker for us, as we have other services relying on the separation of API audiences for security reasons, and cannot merge them into a single audience.
Thank you for your help!
Best regards,
